q: the unusual things teams are coming up with to defend Michael Vick . "I think we're making good adjustments as players and coaches; I like to do that sooner than later," Reid said. We're getting some unique looks. Everybody has a certain way,[ defensively] that they're playing Michael Vick , and it's not your normal- it's hard to put on another tape and see teams do what they do to Michael Vick , they just change things up and throw you a little bit of a curveball. So you have to make some adjustments. You have to be able to do that. Sunday, the biggest adjustment seemed to be the offensive line finally sorting out the Giants' blitzes, giving Michael Vick a little time and room to work with, especially when he decided to run.

If there's anyone in the world that will recover fully from this kind of crime and just unbelievable injury, it's her, the New York senator said. "She's got courage. She's got drive. She's got spirit. And I really think her courage is inspiring to all of us right now.

Eric Schmidt drew fire for responding to a hypothetical question posed at a forum in Washington, D.C., about an implant that would let Google know what its users were thinking. He responded that Google's policy is to get right up to the creepy line and not cross it, and an implant would cross the line. He also said that as users voluntarily share information online, it doesn't need users to type in search queries for the company to tailor the results. "

Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. What of Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin ? He is said to be focusing on strategic projects and is particularly interested in social networking.
